neighborhoods.name: Place de la Libération
neighborhoods.character: Magnificent main square and historic heart of Dijon, featuring elegant 17th-century architecture and the Palais des Ducs
neighborhoods.location: Central Dijon, the main square and surrounding area
neighborhoods.history: Designed by Jules Hardouin-Mansart in the 17th century, this elegant square is surrounded by the Palais des Ducs (Ducal Palace), the Hôtel de Ville, and beautiful arcades. It's the heart of the city and a perfect starting point for exploring Dijon's rich heritage.

practical_info.getting_there: Central location, accessible by tram and bus

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Popular with tourists, locals, and those seeking cultural experiences
neighborhoods.tips: Visit during the day for the best light on the historic buildings. The area is pedestrian-friendly and perfect for exploring Dijon's architectural heritage.

neighborhoods.name: Historic Center (Vieille Ville)
neighborhoods.character: Medieval heart of Dijon with narrow cobblestone streets, half-timbered houses, and distinctive Burgundian architecture
neighborhoods.location: Central Dijon, the old town area
neighborhoods.history: The medieval core of Dijon featuring narrow cobblestone streets, half-timbered houses, hidden courtyards, and distinctive Burgundian architecture. The area is particularly atmospheric in the evening when the historic buildings take on a magical quality.

practical_info.getting_there: Central location, accessible by tram and walking

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Essential for understanding Dijon's history and culture
neighborhoods.tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds and get the best photos. Wear comfortable shoes for cobblestone streets. The area is perfect for walking tours and cultural immersion.

neighborhoods.name: Les Halles Centrales
neighborhoods.character: Authentic local market area with traditional Burgundian atmosphere and fresh produce
neighborhoods.location: Central Dijon, near the historic center
neighborhoods.history: Traditional covered market housed in a beautiful 19th-century building, offering authentic local experience with traditional Burgundian products and foods. The market has served as the city's main food market for centuries.

practical_info.getting_there: Walking distance from center, accessible by tram
practical_info.safety: Safe during market hours, be aware of crowds

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium-High - Great for experiencing local culture and finding fresh food
neighborhoods.tips: Visit early morning for the freshest produce and most authentic experience. Bring cash for purchases. Be respectful when taking photos of vendors and their goods.

neighborhoods.name: Rue des Forges
neighborhoods.character: Elegant historic street lined with beautiful mansions, boutique shops, and traditional restaurants
neighborhoods.location: Central Dijon, connecting Place de la Libération to the historic center
neighborhoods.history: One of Dijon's most beautiful historic streets, lined with elegant mansions, boutique shops, and traditional restaurants. The street showcases Burgundian architecture and is perfect for shopping, dining, and admiring the city's architectural heritage.

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Daytime for shopping, evening for dining
practical_info.getting_there: Central location, walking distance from main attractions

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Excellent for shopping, dining, and architecture appreciation
neighborhoods.tips: This area is perfect for leisurely exploration. Take time to admire the architectural details of the historic buildings. Many shops and restaurants are closed on Sundays.

neighborhoods.name: Porte Guillaume
neighborhoods.character: Historic area with medieval gate ruins and authentic local atmosphere
neighborhoods.location: North of the city center, near the historic city gate
neighborhoods.history: Originally part of Dijon's medieval fortifications, the Porte Guillaume area has been developed with restaurants and cafes while maintaining its historical character. The gate itself offers insight into Dijon's medieval past.

practical_info.getting_there: Walking distance from center, accessible by bus

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium - Good for experiencing authentic local life and history
neighborhoods.tips: This area offers a glimpse into Dijon's medieval past. Good for photographers seeking authentic scenes. Less tourist infrastructure than other areas.

neighborhoods.name: Parc de la Colombière
neighborhoods.character: Scenic park area with beautiful gardens, walking trails, and peaceful atmosphere
neighborhoods.location: Northwest of the city center, on the outskirts
neighborhoods.history: A scenic park located on the outskirts of Dijon offering beautiful gardens, walking trails, and peaceful atmosphere. Features walking trails, viewpoints, and is popular with families and nature lovers.

practical_info.getting_there: Bus connections, walking distance from some areas

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium-High - Excellent for nature, relaxation, and photography
neighborhoods.tips: Visit during spring for blooming flowers or autumn for colorful foliage. Bring water and comfortable walking shoes. Perfect for peaceful walks and relaxation away from the city center.
